pullRequest.body:
As [discussed on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Typeclass.20for.20algebraic.20extension.20of.20fields.3F), this PR replaces the current definition of `Algebra.IsAlgebraic` and `Algebra.IsIntegral` with classes.

The following main changes are required:
 * Since a class must be a structure, we can't identify `Algebra.IsAlgebraic R A` with `âˆ€ (x : A), IsAlgebraic R x`. Either use the projection `.isAlgebraic`, or use the new definition `Algebra.IsAlgebraic.isAlgebraic` which leaves the proof implicit. Idem for integral.
 * Turn `Algebra.IsAlgebraic` and `Algebra.IsIntegral` arguments into instance implicits; turn theorems with those as the conclusion into instances.
 * `Algebra.IsAlgebraic` is now `protected`, like `Algebra.IsIntegral`.

The spelling `Algebra.IsAlgebraic.isAlgebraic x` and `Algebra.IsIntegral.isIntegral x` to prove an element `x` is algebraic/integral is kind of ugly, do you have better suggestions?

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench
Maybe just `Algebra.isAlgebraic x` instead of `Algebra.IsAlgebraic.isAlgebraic x`?

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/570f9801-8fcc-4d44-829f-a33cf6d8c70d) for commit ecdcd1f49e53c94739d286855e5a2ae48d74c364.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/70885a0a-218a-4e28-9ab9-99d33695a29d) for commit 0c7208ddc91bf90b1a77b6449835363a753502ad.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/fa11a807-3b34-4d1a-9aa4-cfa8929c8e0c/to/70885a0a-218a-4e28-9ab9-99d33695a29d) against commit 9edd2350d9396700cf5a446372b94f082479154c:
```diff
  Benchmark                                      Metric         Change
  ====================================================================
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.PurelyInseparable         instructions     5.0%
- ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Embeddings   instructions     8.8%
```
@Vierkantor should we bench again?

Cheap to do. 

!bench
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4b84ebf3-464c-4e7e-872b-5cb9fea74664) for commit acef06f3551dd7c87d324595f89674b9449bdb05.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/044b7968-a8e4-498a-9327-1270ca51ffab/to/4b84ebf3-464c-4e7e-872b-5cb9fea74664) against commit a5eb48ce9eb3a014115cc27e69f022a7d2edd44e:
```diff
  Benchmark                                      Metric         Change
  ====================================================================
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.PurelyInseparable         instructions     5.1%
- ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Embeddings   instructions     8.4%
```

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9114001981/job/25056887599)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9114001981/job/25056888285)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9114001981/job/25056888614)
This is clearly better than the current situation, and I think the bench results are OK, thanks!
Do we really want to keep this `private`?
I think so: since we have to declare the `Algebra` instance inline I don't see how this will apply often or at all.
In that case, shouldn't it be local?
Not sure what you mean, sorry! `private theorem FractionRing.isAlgebraic` followed by `attribute [local instance] FractionRing.isAlgebraic`?
Aah, then the diff that Github shows me at the top of this conversation is misleading. Because it suggests that it is a `private instance`.
Why not making it an `instance` from the beginning?
I'm not sure this is possible inside a `class` declaration, unless you mean `class Normal extends Algebra.IsAlgebraic`? I suppose I can try that out.
Ah sorry, I didn't realize this comes from the definition of `Normal`. No problem then.
Actually, I'm already turning it into `extends` and the extra changes are not so bad! So I'll finish that right now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Turn Algebra.IsAlgebraic and Algebra.IsIntegral into classes
